Just an observation!  While working on ssh remoting between my Windows, Linux, and MacOS, notice that the PSHOME path to executable are not kept consistent.

**".../6-preview"**

_Please notice that in CentOS the PowerShell Core path include "~" tilde instead of a "-" dash._

Steps to reproduce
------------------
Check the following PSHOME variable on each system using Get-Variable:

```powershell
## - Windows PSCore results:
:
PSHOME                         C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6-preview
:

## - Linux PSCore (CentOS) results:
:
PSHOME                         /opt/microsoft/powershell/6.1.0~preview.2
:

## - MacOS PSCore results:
:
PSHOME                         /usr/local/microsoft/powershell/6.1.0-preview.2
:
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
Windows PSCore path is fine!

I would have expect the folder path to end with "6-preview":

```none
## - All the end with ".../microsoft/powershell/6-preview"

## - Linux PSCore (CentOS) > PSHOME =  /opt/microsoft/powershell/6-preview
## - MacOS PSCore > PSHOME =  /usr/local/microsoft/powershell/6-preview

```

Actual behavior
---------------
On Windows is fine. But, in Linux (all distro) and MacOS are not ".../6-preview".

```none
## - Linux PSCore (all Linux Distro) > PSHOME =  /opt/microsoft/powershell/6.1.0~preview.2
## - MacOS PSCore > PSHOME =  /usr/local/microsoft/powershell/6.1.0-preview.2
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
PSVersion                      6.1.0-preview.2
```
title: PSCore - Keep 'pwsh' executable path consistent ending with "../6-preview"
